title: Queen Of White Dunes
opening: Thanks to the arrival of reinforcements from Princess L’Arachel of Rausten, Eirika and her allies successfully repel the Grado invaders. Still, Jehanna Hall remains under siege, on the edge of ruin. En route, Eirika learns that the hall has indeed been captured by Grado. To rescue Queen Ismaire and recover Jehanna’s Sacred Stone, Eirika leads an assault on the royal hall.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: ...I yield. The point is yours, Eirika. You’re swift, aren’t you? Compared to you, I’m– I’ve been bested at fencing by a woman. Pitiful crown prince, am I not?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Oh, no, Eirika. It is. The people need a strong ruler. They don’t want a weakling like me. They want the strength you and Ephraim share. My body is frail. I prefer to spend my time locked away in the castle, reading... I think my father would be better served if someone else took my place. I’m sure all of our retainers feel the same...

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: You’re wrong, Lyon. An emperor without compassion will never hold the people’s love. And one day, your compassion will surely save us all. I believe that.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Eirika... Thank you. Yes. I...I will do my best. Even though I lack your strength, there must be some good I can do.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: By the way, Eirika... If it please you, would you accept this?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika? Is there something wrong?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Jehanna Hall has been completely occupied by Grado soldiers. I’m sorry to report that Queen Ismaire is already...

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: And the one giving orders to the troops in the palace is Crown Prince Lyon?

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: What is there to give us pause? Should we not storm the palace and retake it by strength of arms?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Frelia’s spy network reports that Prince Lyon is an initiate of dark magic. If this is true, even approaching him will be a serious challenge. I’d heard the prince dislikes violence. However, it could all have been a ruse.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Still, if we don’t retake the palace, we’ve no hope of defeating Grado. We must rescue the queen, no matter the cost...

intro.speaker: Carlyle
intro.line: Queen Ismaire... Please do not resist. I have no desire to see you harmed.

intro.speaker: Ismaire
intro.line: Carlyle... Why have you betrayed us? After all these years of loyal service as Jehanna’s most decorated commander... Without you, I could not have ruled these long years since my husband’s passing. It was through your unwavering support alone that I still sit upon the throne. You are the cornerstone of Jehanna. You have held my trust more than any man. So tell me why. Why have you betrayed us? Why have you betrayed me?

intro.speaker: Carlyle
intro.line: Your Highness–No... My queen... Ismaire... It is your own fault. You are too lovely, my queen.

intro.speaker: Carlyle
intro.line: The first time I met you, twenty years ago now... I saw you in the garden of this very palace... and I was bewitched. Your pale beauty far surpassed that of any flower. I was in the grips of an unforgivable desire. You were the wife of my king, to whom I’d sworn life and loyalty. I told myself a grand lie that day. I told myself I could be happy simply serving you as your most loyal knight.

intro.speaker: Carlyle
intro.line: After years of duty, years of service, years of...of silence... I became aware once more of the feelings I’d buried deep within myself. How could I leave this world without expressing my true desires? Could anything be more desolate? More devoid of meaning? That is when I made my decision. I would follow my heart and claim your hand as my own.

intro.speaker: Ismaire
intro.line: Carlyle... You forget yourself. You ruin our country and kill our countrymen. Did you think I would be pleased? Did you think I would love you for this?

intro.speaker: Carlyle
intro.line: I need no country. I care nothing for my countrymen. I can see nothing but you. If you would only be mine...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: To arms, mercenaries. We’re under attack! You there! Ready your weapons!

battle.speaker: Rennac
battle.line: What?!? No, no, no. That was never part of the deal. The only fight I’m here for is with the locks of the treasure chamber.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Hah... Don’t get so excited. I doubt you mercenaries will see any action at all once we soldiers’ve finished.

battle.speaker: Rennac
battle.line: Yeah, great. You go do that. Whew... With all these soldiers around, I shouldn’t have to lift a finger. I’ll just sit here and wait for them to win they day. Then, I collect my pay! No more being ordered around by that selfish princess and her moronic bodyguard. This is the life. Lady Luck loves me. But something doesn’t feel right...

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Hey, Carlyle! Impressive work you’ve done here. My compliments.

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: ...I gave you everything I promised. I opened the hall to your forces.

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Yes. The palace is mine. My palace... Oh, how I do like the sound of that.

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: Do whatever you want with the royal treasury. The only treasure I wish to leave here with is the queen of my heart.

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Oh, yeah, about your queen?.. There’s been a change of plans.

battle.speaker: Ismaire
battle.line: Ah!

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Don’t move, Carlyle. You twitch, and the queen dies.

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: Blackheart! What is the meaning of this?

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Calm down. You’ll get her back as soon as I’m done with her. Jehanna’s Sacred Stone is around here somewhere. I’ve got to find it and destroy it. I need this woman to guide me to its hiding place.

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: Do not lay a hand on my queen!

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: Don’t get so incensed. I’m not going to harm her. I’m not like that freak Valter. I’m kind to women. But if you make a wrong move, you’ll lose your prize. Understood?

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: Yes...

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: There are some annoying pests outside who think to win back the hall. I want you to take care of them. Lose, and the queen will never be yours.

battle.speaker: Carlyle
battle.line: ...... If my queen comes to any harm in your care...

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Yes, of course. I know all about the might of your sword arm. As long as the Sacred Stone is destroyed, you’ll get all you ask for.

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: Greetings, Prince. Let’s get going.

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Caellach... You will put an end to this. Destroying the Sacred Stones is... Ugh...ack...

battle.speaker: Caellach
battle.line: What’s this? Are you still ill? You know, you’re not very princely. C’mon. Follow me.

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Caellach...

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Hey, that’s a comely lass. Think I’ll have a few words... Wait. Er, haven’t I met you before?

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: You... You were traveling with L’Arachel before, weren’t you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Oh, yeah... Renais... I’ve got to get–

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: L’Arachel is traveling with us. Should I let her know you’re here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Uh, no! Wait a moment! You... You don’t have to bother her. Actually I wanted to ask you something. How would you like to hire me? The name’s Rennac. I’m a world-class thief, and proud of it. A man of many talents. Lockpicks are for amateurs. I can pick chests and doors with my bare hands. And I’m better with a blade than most swordsmen.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Uh...

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: I’m a useful fellow to have around. And cheap, too! Only 9,980 gold! Well, what do you think?

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Fine. I’ll pay the 9,980 gold.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Very good! You know a bargain when you see one, don’t you? Not at all like a certain pious princess I know.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Were you speaking of L’Arachel?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Uh, no... Idle chitchat about that lass is bound to land me in hot water. Right, then! You’re my new boss. Point out any doors or chests, and get out of my way!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Aha! So this is where you’ve wandered off to, Rennac!

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Princess L’Arachel? Uh-oh, um...

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Come with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Wait... hold on now. Go with you where? Look, sorry, but I’ve been hired by the Grado Empire, and... Hello! I’m talking to you!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Rennac, whatever is the matter? I promise to listen to your story later, but now, we must be going!

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: No, I’m no servant, like that kook Dozla. I’m a mercenary. I escorted you to Renais like I was hired to do, didn’t I? You have no right to drag me across creation without any pay whatsoever!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Is this about wages? I believe you’ve received ample compensation.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Ample?! Do you even know what that word means? You’ve the princess of Rausten! I thought working for you would pay well. Yet your purse strings are knotted tight, and I’ve almost been killed so many–

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: The joy that comes from doing good is not something that can be purchased. There. All better? Let’s go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: NO! I said I don’t want to! Riding with you is– ...And there she goes. Oh...By the Stones, why did I ever take that job in the first place?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: We must hurry, Rennac.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Right, right. I’m coming...

boss.speaker: Carlyle
boss.line: I...I just wanted the two of us...

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: This is as good a place as any. All right, Your Majesty. Hand over the Sacred Stone.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: ...I know nothing of the Sacred Stone’s keeping place.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Don’t waste me time. My partner here sees everything. When the rebellion began, you went straight to the palace altar. You had hoped to prevent us from smashing the Sacred Stone. But you have the Stone of Jehanna with you right now, don’t you?

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Hand it over. Cooperate, and I’ll let you live.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: ...I cannot.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Oh, give it up, will you? I’ve no time for games. If you resist, I’ll just kill you and take it anyway.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: H-hold! You mustn’t harm her, Caellach...

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Shut up, Prince. My orders come from higher than you. You’ve not going to start disobeying his word, are you?

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Last chance. Give me your Sacred Stone.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: ...I cannot.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Ha ha! A queen to the end. I like you. You’ve got guts. Good-bye.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Ah!

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: And here’s the Sacred Stone. That makes two for me. I’m on a roll now.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: And another Sacred Stone has been destroyed. Grado, Frelia, and now Jehanna... Only two stones remain.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Uuh...ahh...

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Ah... What should I do? C-Caellach... You must help her.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Leave her. Let her last breath be a harsh and ragged rasp. She’s not long for this world. Why, if you really wanted to help her, you’d deliver the final blow yourself!

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: N-no. I couldn’t.

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: ...What a joke. I have a little work to wrap up in the hall before we leave. You should hit the road pretty soon, too, Prince.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I wonder where Queen Ismaire is.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: I heard she was in the throne room, but there’s no sight of her. And there’s no Sacred Stone, either.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: We must search quickly.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Ah...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Lyon!

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Eirika...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Wait, Lyon! Don’t run away! My brother and I have been so worried about you... We know more then anyone the gentleness of your spirit. Your father is deranged, isn’t he? That’s why Grado invaded Renais, right? Tell me, Lyon... Please... Tell me what has happened.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: I’m sorry, Eirika. I’ve wanted to see you and Ephraim for so long now... I wanted to see you so that I could apologize. The invasion of Renais... I couldn’t stop it. I’m sorry, but I still cannot talk to you. Not yet...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: You... You have a reason, don’t you?

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Mm... I can’t talk about it now, but... I promise I will tell you everything someday.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I see... I believe you, Lyon. I must tell you, I’m a little relieved. I was afraid you’d changed as much as your poor father has. I’m so glad.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Me, too, Eirika... No, you have changed. You’re even more beautiful than you were before.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: L-Lyon...

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: I’m sorry, I have to go. But please remember this. This war started because I was too weak to stop it, but... I’ll always be your friend.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Lyon...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Eirika, what are you doing? It seems Queen Ismaire has been found. This way!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Y-yes. Coming!

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Queen Ismaire... Is she...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: We’re too late. Her injuries are... She will not last much longer.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: ...Jo...Joshua... ...Joshua...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Queen Ismaire!

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Oh, Joshua... Where is...that boy...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Queen Ismaire...

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Please forgive me, Joshua... I was a foolish mother... I was so intent on being queen that I spared no time to be your mother. But I loved you nonetheless... Please understand...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: ..... I know, Mother.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Joshua...

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Joshua... It really is you... Joshua...my son...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: I’m sorry, Mother. I should never have left you. I’ve no excuse... I wanted to see the world as a man, not as a prince. I wanted to be worthy. I planned on returning to your side afterward... I was so foolish. If I’d been here, I could have–

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: No, it’s fine. You’re here now... Listen to me, Joshua. The Stone of Jehanna has... been destroyed. The one who tempted Carlyle is responsible...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: What? Who was it?

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: ...Carried a dark stone... It is...the origin of all this... It should not exist... Joshua...you must... Our country...our people...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: I understand, Mother.

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Thank you...Joshua... I have something... Something I must give you...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: This is...

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: It’s one of the Sacred Twin relics, unique to House Jehanna... He who would rule our land must possess it... I’ve watched over it since your father passed away. I kept it safe and waited for this day to come...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: Mother... I have it now. I understand its meaning...

end.speaker: Ismaire
end.line: Joshua... My...dear, sweet child...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: Mother...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: It’s been more than ten years. I’d grown tied of the formality of palace life, so I...just left. I wrote a farewell and left the palace, taking nothing with me. I felt I could never understand the people while I stayed sequestered in a castle. I abandoned my identity and roamed the continent, working where I could. I wanted only to be worthy of becoming king. I knew one day I would return. Gods, I was so foolish! I was such a child, I see it now. Was I simply rebelling against my mother? Punishing her for tending to her duties?

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: I was a fool, yes, but I learned much over these ten years. I have learned about the hearts of our people, how they need to be governed. I have learned how our country needs to change and to grow. I have learned much, but I’ve lost much more. Mother...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Prince Joshua...

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: I made a promise. I want to continue what she began. I will help defeat Grado. I will defend Jehanna and her allies. ...I know it doesn’t sound like me, but...

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: On behalf of Frelia, I came to Jehanna with a letter to the throne. I give it to you. Prince Joshua of Jehanna... Let us fight together.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Renais, Frelia, Rausten, and Jehanna. Four nations...united!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, I suppose that’s true. And my brother is with us as well. And if it were possible... Lyon... I wish you could be here with us, too.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Fire! Fires have broken out all through the hall!

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: The curtains were soaked in oil, with torches set about the hall. It’s a trap! Someone did this during all the fighting. You must flee! Quickly, before the flames engulf us all!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika. We must evacuate...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I know. Joshua, we must go. Now.

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: No... Mother... Forgive me...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Is everyone well? Did anyone get left behind?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: We all made it. It’s so smoky that it’s hard to tell, but we’re here. What a cowardly act, setting fire to the palace hall. But we’ve escaped without injury. The enemy’s trap has failed.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: ...No, it hasn’t. Assemble the troops now. The enemy is coming.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: This is the reason for the fire. To drive us from the palace. They’ll be attacking soon. No other plan makes sense.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: How is it that you know that?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika. I’ve just received word that Grado reinforcements are headed this way. There are two armies, led by Generals Valter and Caellach.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No!

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Two armies... They’re willing to send so many here and leave the capital defenseless?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Why does everyone seem so distraught? It matters not who stands in our path. We shall smite them all with the power of righteousness!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika... It’s going to be very difficult for us to continue. One of Grado’s generals alone is more than a match for us. Compound that with the exhaustion of our troops, and I’m not sure we can–

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Bah... With Jehanna Hall in flames, we’ve no place to hole up and dig in for a siege. We have to retreat. We have to win ourselves time for form a plan. Grado sent two generals... What could be happening in their capital? And what of Ephraim? Is he still alive?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ...Brother...
